google_play_reviews.content: very bad, i tried many ways but can't connect from smartphone to website

Would not connect to a server. Doesn't just work "out of the box" with minimal configuration the way a phone app should. Useless. It's SSL problems that people have been having forever, according to Google. I'm sure some smug jerkoff from the community would tell me to read a tutorial, but that essentially boils down to me having to fix something the devs won't. After resolving this, I find changing the server's port is needlessly complicated instead of just having a setting in the server's UI.

You definitely messed something in version 2.17.4. Everything become slow and stuck and main issue here is that the HABPanel is not working anymore on remote configuration. It always stack on "No default panel configuration!" - and yes I logged in ,in local it works.
Have used openHAB for years now and have tried other smart home systems. Absolutely the best for home/smart system control. Great job guys/gals!

google_play_reviews.content: Highly rated for geeks that live in the world of full custom installation. I want an open app- find network - add network - build devices map - attach devices, program devices app. Create server? Nonsense.

OpenHAB is a fantastic home automation system. Finally I have control over everything and don't have a cloud this or data collection that or device that connects to China. The learning curve is steep but it's well worth it. Thanks for your hard work OpenHAB devs. I'm also really happy to see support for multiple sites finally land in the app!

google_play_reviews.content: Worst app in Google Play Store! 🏆 The openhab system is probably the worst software ever developed: it's terribly counterintuitive, uselessly hard to program and manage and with the worst performances for a system that just have to manage simple mqtt connections and if/else clauses (everytime it boots, takes something like 30/40 minutes to run). Go for Home Assistant ASAP.
App could not reach server, while Chrome could. Using IP instead servername in app setup caused switching from IPv6 to IPv4 and server became reachable.

I'm just to start using openhabian with RaspberryPi and this app. I'm not software developer and facing difficulties to working with this software. If possible, this app may be made more user friendly like Amazon Alexa app using Bluetooth connection, including all connection setup, configuration etc. as the RPi has also Bluetooth. I'm keenly interested in this software for making my home automation using RaspberryPi.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Hi,
the app can only connect to the Raspberry over Wi-Fi. It's not planned to connect over Bluetooth.
I recommend to ask questions on https://community.openhab.org/ as there are more people that can help you.

Best wishes,
openHAB Android Team

google_play_reviews.content: Nutze die App auf mehreren Handys die als feste Steuerung in den Räumen als Always-On verteilt sind. Funktioniert bei 3en bisher problemlos, ein S7 Edge gibt aber nach wenigen Minuten ständig die Fehlermeldung "Die Sitemap konnte nicht geladen werden. Der folgende Fehler ist aufgetreten: Verbindung zum Host fehlgeschlagen". Am Host scheint es nicht zu liegen, sonst hätten die anderen 3 Geräte auch Probleme. Komischerweise ist das S9 Edge direkt neben dem Router auch mit der stärksten Signalstärke. Nach einem Klick auf "Erneut versuchen" klappt es auch immer direkt, aber etwas nervig.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Hallo Tobias,
in einer zukünftigen Version wird bei einem solchen Fehler nach 30 Sekunden automatisch erneut versucht: https://github.com/openhab/openhab-android/pull/2363

google_play_reviews.content: Great development!

google_play_reviews.content: Love it
Fantastic, flexible and powerfull app!
Amazing if you know how to utilize it
Always works, constantly updated, great app.
The latest update with Quick Settings tile is great! Great work OH team
Works as expected.

The setting to use svg icons is missing. It used to be there. It is on the iOS app. I use svg icons and now they don't work when switches are used. The icons don't change state anymore. It turns out it is the data saver option that stopped the refresh of the icons. All good now. I have 2 identical phones and one worked and the other didn't and now i know why. Data saver! Thanks for the help. It was the data saver on the phone setting and not the data saver on the app!
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Hey Greg,
I guess you're facing two new features here: 1. With openHAB server 2.5 the icon format is automatically chosen. SVG is preferred, except there is a custom PNG icon with the same name. 2. If data saver is on (either the in-app one or the one by the OS), icons are always loaded with the default state to save data. Are images loaded?
Cheers

google_play_reviews.content: Amazing

Was good. Update introduced a bug in the setpoint widgets. For a setpoint widget with step=0.5, if the widget has a current value with a fraction, e.g. 14.5, the widget behaves correctly. But, if the current value is a whole number, e.g. 14, then the list of values are displayed as integers with each value twice, e.g. 13,13,14,14,15,15 etc., i.e. 14.5 is displayed as 14. Also, the up arrow increments by 1, and the down arrow doesn't work. Fixed - All good now, thanks!
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Hey Peter,
this sounds like an issue that has been fixed recently. Do you still have any issues?

Cheers,
openHAB Team

Took me a while to figure out how to set this up, but that's no surprise given its flexibility in handling a wide variety of devices. Documentation isn't perfect, but you can  get most of your answers from examples and forum discussions . Ed. 2019Mar: 2 years and still going strong.Upgrades to OpenHAB and its bindings and extensions can kill things. You'll need from forums, documentations, and other users experiences to fix, upgrade, or workaround.  HABPanel helps you do away with this app for most practical purposes,  The review is about the whole of OpenHAB and not just this app.

google_play_reviews.content:
Great app, just since last update label colors defined in sitemap stopped 
working in this app. Basic UI still works. Can you get this functionality 
back please? Thank you
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Hey Jan,
we changed the way how colors are shown: When having a dark theme and the label/value color "black" it is set to white instead, otherwise the text would be hard to read. If you want to enfore a color, please use the hexcode for a color in the sitemap file instead. If colors are not working at all, please open a thread in the forum. Thanks!

google_play_reviews.content: There are improvements that can be made but there is a good consistent effort for improvements. Appreciate the work and enthusiasm

It's broken! Can't use volume keys to dim lights anymore. Feel like a crippled Apple user now. And new icon sucks. Looks too much like OpenVPN icon.  Old review: It's a 3.5. Maybe a 4. If it supported multiple servers it wouldn't be less than a 4.5. Multiple sitemaps on the same server it'll see but I have to rely on 3hou.se to use my setup at work AND home without changing settings all the time. 3hou.se actually auto detects servers too. Can we get that here? Kthxbai!
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Hey Mike,
we decided to remove the feature to control slider items with the volume buttons as it was very limited (only one slider) and undiscoverable. If you don't like the new icon, feel free to use a launcher with the ability to change app icons. Multiple sitemaps and auto discovery are both support. For more questions: community.openhab.org

google_play_reviews.content: Great app and client certificates work again. Thanks very much.
